sen.j: 綜芸種智院（しゅげいしゅちいん）は、天長5年12月15日 (旧暦)（829年1月23日）、空海が庶民教育や各種学芸の綜合的教育を目的に、藤原三守から譲り受けた京都の左京九条の邸宅に設置した私立学校といわれている。
sen.e: It is said that the Shugei Shuchiin school was a private school which was established by Kukai on January 23, 829, at the residence in Sakyo Kujo in Kyoto which was received from FUJIWARA no Mimori, for the purpose of educating the common people and comprehensively educating various liberal arts.

sen.e: The Shugei Shuchiin school was originally written as 綜藝種智院 in Chinese characters, but is generally written as 綜芸種智院 using a new style at present.

sen.j: 綜芸とは、各種の学芸を綜合するという意味。
sen.e: Shugei means generalizing various liberal arts.

sen.j: この時代、原則的には中央の教育機関であった大学寮は主に貴族の、地方の教育機関であった国学 (律令制の教育機関)は郡司の子弟を対象としていた。
sen.e: A principle in this period was that Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), educational institution of central government, targeted nobilities, and Kokugaku (provincial schools) (educational institution under the ritsuryo system), local educational institutions, targeted younger people of gunji (district managers).

sen.e: The major subject at Daigaku and Kokugaku was mainly Confucianism, and Buddhism and Taoism were not taught there.

sen.j: 空海は、こうした現状を打破しようと、天長5年付で「綜芸種智院式并序」（『性霊集』巻十）を著して、全学生・教員への給食制を完備した身分貧富に関わりなく学ぶことのできる教育施設、俗人も僧侶も儒教・仏教・道教などあらゆる思想・学芸を総合的に学ぶことのできる教育施設の設立を提唱した。
sen.e: Kukai who tried to move beyond this status quo wrote 'Shugei Shuchiin School Shiki narabinijo' ("Shoryoshu (Collected Works of Prose and Poetry of Kukai" with ten volumes) in 828, and proposed the establishment of educational facility fully providing school lunches to all students and teachers where all people could learn whatever their social status, and rich and poor alike, and where both seculars and priests could comprehensively learn all thoughts and liberal arts such as Confucianism, Buddhism, Taoism and so on.

sen.j: その恒久的な運営を実現するため、天皇、大臣諸侯、仏教諸宗の高僧らをはじめ、広く世間に支持・協力を呼びかけたのである。
sen.e: In order to realize a permanent operation of such educational facility, Kukai asked many people including the Emperor, ministers, marquises, high priests of all sects of Buddhism to provide support and cooperation.

sen.j: 綜芸種智院は、空海の死後10年ほど経た承和 (日本)12年（845年）、所期の成果を挙げることが困難になったとして、弟子たちによる協議の末売却された。
sen.e: The Shugei Shuchiin school was sold out after discussions among disciples in 845 ten years after the death of Kukai, by reason that it became difficult to obtain desired results.

sen.e: The profit on sale was appropriated for purchase of Terada region (in Taki-gun, Tanba Province, later Oyamasho) to secure revenues for fostering monks of Shingon sect of To-ji Temple.

sen.j: 廃絶理由として、財源不足、後継者難、真言教団維持優先への路線転換、構想自体の非現実性、実際は朝廷による民衆懐柔のための一時的施設であったとする見方など、様々な理由があげられている。
sen.e: As a reason for abolishment, various reasons are named such as revenue shortfalls, lack of successors, policy change to giving a high priority to keeping of Shingon-shu sect religious group, unreality of idea itself, view that the Shugei Shuchiin school was actually a temporary facility to conciliate the people by the Imperial Court, and so on.
